unit_learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate an understanding of concepts and theory that underpin advanced devices and/or techniques.
apply advanced research skills in an authentic context.
analyse, interpret and present new research results correctly and coherently, in accordance with discipline standards.
identify and articulate how a research project fits within the context of, and contributes to, a wider field of research.
use sophisticated instrumentation and/or software tools effectively.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Three weeks of research activity, spread through the session.

assessments.description: Formal report documenting their project work, including, data generated, analysis, and outcomes.
Formal report documenting relevant background literature and supporting theory for the student project.

Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

data.subject_search_title: PHYS7911 - Physics and Astronomy Advanced Lab
data.description: This unit will provide students with a bespoke research-based learning path in physics and/or astronomy, tailored to the students' individual development needs. Students will complete a short research project within an active research group, mentored by unit staff as well as by research leaders. Students will write a formal report on their project, including reviewing relevant background literature and supporting theory.
